options.label: Three wheels must always touch the ground
Load center must stay within the triangle formed by wheel contact points
Forks should form a triangle shape

items.explain: Keeping the load center within the stability triangle prevents tipping.

items.prompt: When traveling with a load, forks should be:

options.label: Tilted forward to secure the load

items.explain: Low position with slight back tilt provides maximum stability.
Both height and forward load center reduce safe capacity.

items.prompt: Before lifting a load, you should:

options.label: Check the load weight against capacity chart
Test lift slowly and feel for stability

items.explain: Always verify load weight against the capacity chart before lifting.

options.label: Turn quickly to minimize exposure time
Make wide, slow turns to maintain stability
Lean into the turn to counterbalance

items.explain: Wide, slow turns prevent load shift and maintain stability.
